body_html:
1. Latest TensorFlow supports CUDA 8-9.2. CuDNN 6-7, or perhaps earlier versions as well.
  2. Each TensorFlow binary only works with the version of CUDA and CuDNN it is built with.
  3. Official latest TensorFlow binaries (the one downloadable from pypi or conda) are built with CUDA 9.0, CuDNN 7
  4. If you don't like to install a different version of Nvidia software, you can:
    (1) Use non-official binaries built by others. e.g.: https://github.com/mind/wheels/releases, https://github.com/hadim/docker-tensorflow-builder#builds
    (2) Build the binaries by yourself from source with your version of Nvidia software
body_text:
Latest TensorFlow supports CUDA 8-9.2. CuDNN 6-7, or perhaps earlier versions as well.
Each TensorFlow binary only works with the version of CUDA and CuDNN it is built with.
Official latest TensorFlow binaries (the one downloadable from pypi or conda) are built with CUDA 9.0, CuDNN 7
If you don't like to install a different version of Nvidia software, you can:
(1) Use non-official binaries built by others. e.g.: https://github.com/mind/wheels/releases, https://github.com/hadim/docker-tensorflow-builder#builds
(2) Build the binaries by yourself from source with your version of Nvidia software
body:
1. Latest TensorFlow __supports__ CUDA 8-9.2. CuDNN 6-7, or perhaps earlier versions as well.
2. Each TensorFlow binary only works with the version of CUDA and CuDNN it is built with.
3. Official latest TensorFlow binaries (the one downloadable from pypi or conda) are built with CUDA 9.0, CuDNN 7
4. If you don't like to install a different version of Nvidia software, you can:
(1) Use non-official binaries built by others. e.g.: https://github.com/mind/wheels/releases, https://github.com/hadim/docker-tensorflow-builder#builds
(2) Build the binaries by yourself from source with your version of Nvidia software
